title: Twitter Freezes Hiring as Two Senior Executives Leave the Company; General managers Bruce Falck and Kayvon Beykpour are departing amid Elon Musk's takeover
text:
In an internal memo, Mr. Agrawal also said that effective this week the company is implementing a hiring freeze. He said that some job offers may be rescinded but that companywide layoffs aren't currently planned.

The memo cited the general economic environment and the war in Ukraine as factoring into the hiring pause.

The executive departures come weeks after the social-media platform agreed to be acquired by Elon Musk for $44 billion.

Jay Sullivan is replacing both executives, according to a spokesperson for the company. Mr. Sullivan has served as vice president of product since November, according to his LinkedIn profile.

Mr. Beykpour announced his departure in a series of tweets, saying he was asked to leave the company by Mr. Agrawal while he was on paternity leave.
